snippet: A warming planet is responsible for the glorious colors of fall lasting so late in the year, scientists say, but they warn it could have a negative effect on the foliage over the longer term....
abstract: Scientists say climate change explains why fall foliage changes are lingering longer into year across northern United States and Canada; delay has economic benefit of fueling more so-called 'leaf-peeping' tourism, but scientists caution long-term impact on foliage itself is uncertain.
lead_paragraph: A warming planet is responsible for the glorious colors of fall lasting so late in the year, scientists say, but they warn it could have a negative effect on the foliage over the longer term.

headline.main: How a Changing Climate Is Shaping a Leaf Peeper’s Paradise
headline.print_headline: How a Changing Climate Helps Add Color to a Leaf Peeper’s Paradise
